name: Rusty Lake Hotel
description: Rusty Lake Hotel an eerie point-and-click adventure developed by the creators of the intriguing Cube Escape series.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP/Vista/7,8, 10 Processor: 1.8 Ghz Processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 40 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Short, but challenging game with really great (and weird) puzzles! The atmosphere is also very, very good, it is like a horror story written and directed by Wes Anderson...  + Haunting and weird + Captivating atmosphere + Really great puzzles - Voice acting is 'B movie' like - Short (but fits for the price!)  - It is a Flash game...

Took the entire first level to figure out the devs thought process on how to do the puzzles and I didn't have any trouble with them after that. When I got around to 'helping' Ms. Pidgeon however I had a small snit when I realized I was doing algebra for the first time since High School.  So wrong to snobbishly tell my teachers I would never use those skills again.   10/10 Would do math to murder hotel guests again
Not just your typical walk-in-the-park point and click. Extremely interesting and challenging. Definitely worth the price. I thoroughly enjoyed it.
Interesting story, eerie and charming soundtrack, great aesthetic, simple yet elegant art, moderately challenging puzzles, some replayablility.

A clever puzzle game with an excellent atmosphere. Good art style and music really give the game an eerie and unsettling feeling. The puzzles are for the most part fair. The only time they gave me any trouble was when I had looked over something myself, or just missed something completely. At two dollars, an excellent value for the 2-3 hours you'll spend playing it.
